grounding: The COVID-19 pandemic has arguably been one of the worst global catastrophes over the last several decades. A plethora of real-time research has been produced by the finance profession to try and understand the impact COVID-19 had on financial markets. In this issue, the Annual Review of Financial Economics provides five articles, all touching on different aspects of the COVID-19 crisis. This introductory article provides a brief review of these articles.
generated_text: This special issue of the ARFE journal explores the intersection of financial economics and COVID-19, focusing on the impact of the pandemic on financial stability and markets. We examine the role of epidemiological models in predicting household behavior and financial decision-making, particularly in the context of fixed income investments. The issue provides a comprehensive analysis of the financial implications of COVID-19, shedding light on the resilience of financial systems and the adaptability of households.
